metadata.title: Rescue, Archiving and Retrieval of Historic Bering Sea Crab Data

creators.name: Conservation Engineering Division  (RACE), Alaska Fisheries Science Center (AFSC), National Oceanic

metadata.description:
Establishing a time series of information on resources of eastern Bering Sea (EBS) king and Tanner crabs is a major
responsibility of the NMFS Kodiak Laboratory. Information includes results of surveys, fishery data and results of biological
research. This data base serves research and modeling efforts concerning population dynamics, fishery management and
ecology. Users of this information include the North Pacific Fishery Management Council, other NMFS offices (e.g., Auke
Bay Laboratory, Seattle Laboratory), other NOAA offices (e.g., Pacific Marine Environmental Laboratory), The Alaska
Department of Fish and Game, various universities (e.g., Univ. of Alaska, Univ. of Washington) and the fishing industry. A
wider scope of users is anticipated when our data bases become available on internet. 

The EBS crab program resided in the Seattle Laboratory during the 1950's and was later transferred to the Auke Bay
Laboratory. In 1972 the program was transferred to the Kodiak Laboratory. Data series standardized from 1975 onward and
there are some computerized series that extend back to 1968. The Auke Bay Laboratory recently transferred archives to
Kodiak that extend back to the inception of U.S. interest on EBS crab resources (ca 1939). These archives contain original
data forms, edited data listings, punch cards and various documentation. Many data sources were apparently never reduced to
electronic media. Others are primary sources for validating existing electronic sources. Archived materials contain many items
that are singular or otherwise not available. Because they are mostly paper media and many of them considerably aged,
materials are in danger of being lost due to accident or further deterioration. 

Because of our current personnel situation we will need to contract expertise in data base storage, management and retrieval
that we estimate would be equivalent to approximately one full time employee for two years.
metadata.notes:
Purpose: To record the rescued, archived and retrieval of Historic Bering Sea Crab Data

Status: Complete

Maintenance frequency: None Planned
